title: Pattern matching with overlapping matches crash the compiler

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
The following code, compiled on Ubuntu 12.04.3 LTS _Precise Pangolin_ - Release i386 (20130820.1) :

``` rust
fn main() {
    let sl = ~[1,2,3];
    let v : int = match sl.as_slice() {
        [] => 0,
        [a,b,c] => 3,
        [a, ..rest] => a,
        [10,a, ..rest] => 10
    };
}
```

causes rustc to spew forth:

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected failure
This message reflects a bug in the Rust compiler. 
We would appreciate a bug report: http://static.rust-lang.org/doc/master/complement-bugreport.html
note: the compiler hit an unexpected failure path. this is a bug
Ok(task 'rustc' failed at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /home/haralkar/source/other/rust/src/libstd/option.rs:152
)
```

stack trace:
